begin_code.h File Reference

This file sets things up for C dynamic library function definitions, static inlined functions, and structures aligned at 4-byte alignment. More...


Defines

 Some compilers use a special export keyword.
#define SDLCALL
 By default SDL uses the C calling convention.
#define __inline__   inline
 If inlining isn't supported, remove "__inline__", turning static inlined functions into static functions (resulting in code bloat in all files which include the offending header files).
#define SDL_INLINE_OKAY
 Set up compiler-specific options for inlining functions.

Detailed Description

This file sets things up for C dynamic library function definitions, static inlined functions, and structures aligned at 4-byte alignment.

Force structure packing at 4 byte alignment.

This shouldn't be nested -- included it around code only.

If you don't like ugly C preprocessor code, don't look at this file. :)

This is necessary if the header is included in code which has structure packing set to an alternate value, say for loading structures from disk. The packing is reset to the previous value in close_code.h

Define Documentation

#define DECLSPEC

Some compilers use a special export keyword.

#define SDLCALL

By default SDL uses the C calling convention.

#define __inline__   inline

If inlining isn't supported, remove "__inline__", turning static inlined functions into static functions (resulting in code bloat in all files which include the offending header files).

#define SDL_INLINE_OKAY

Set up compiler-specific options for inlining functions.

#define NULL   ((void *)0)

Apparently this is needed by several Windows compilers.
